context: [8] TheKs for sulfide of strain SYR1 was determined by measuring the initial MT formation rate of cell suspensions incubated with various concentrations of sulfide (added as sodium sulfide). [1] Demethylation of methoxylated aromatic compounds by strain SYR1.The influence of temperature on the demethylation activity was tested by incubation of cell extracts at various temperatures (20 to 40Â°C).  [2] Maximum demethylation activity, measured as the MT formed, was found at 25Â°C.  [3] The oxygen sensitivity of demethylation was tested by preincubating the cell extract under an air atmosphere in the absence and presence of ATP.

The study investigates the formation of methyl thioether (MT) from sulfide and the influence of temperature on demethylation processes. Methyl groups are integral to the chemical structure and reactions involving methylsulfanylmethane, indicating a direct relationship in the context of biochemical transformations.
